intro: Hypenanthe venosum, commonly known as the veiny hypenanthe, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, often showy inflorescences. The plant features delicate, veined leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and are clustered in umbels, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, Hypenanthe venosum is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
